We are all of us agreed that either of these courses would be quite unacceptable and would gravelyimperil the prospects of stimulating recruitment, upon which the ending of National Service depends.3* We have, however, with considerable difficulty found it possible to accept a number of other cuts in the defence estimates,amounting in all to about 18 millions, made up as follows - millionsAdmiraltyWar office air ministry ministry of SupplyR, & D.Nuclear Test3-133(plus 51 millionsoff the civil estimates)184, As a result of these cuts, the defence estimates as a whole will be red iced to 1,474 millions. This is 8 millions less than theestimates for the current year and 41 millions below the forecast ofactual expenditure.-1- 5. We can, therefore, properly claim that we have, by economies,fully absorbed the proposed increases in pay and allowances of 35 millions, as well as the rise in industrial costs during the yearamounting to about 50 millions and also some 20 millions ofcompensation to redundant personnel.D jS.Ministry of Defence, S.W.1.2nd January, 195S
